Package ohos.agp.text

Class CharInputFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.text.InputFilter
      • ohos.agp.text.CharInputFilter

  • public final class CharInputFilter
extends InputFilter
    Implements a character filter, which supports filtering of plain text and RichText. This API can filter characters that are not in the valid character set you specified. To specify a valid character set, you are advised to use a regular expression, for example, [\\+-\\.\\d], for its powerful functions. In a simplest case, if you want to explicitly state which characters are valid, for example, abcde, then you need to set the regular expression to [abcde]. For ease of use and understanding, the following two use cases are provided: CharInputFilter#NUMBER and CharInputFilter#ALPHABET. The specified regular expression is used to ensure that each character in the input text, other than the entire input text, meets the rules of the regular expression.
    Since:
    7

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static CharInputFilter ALPHABET

      static CharInputFilter NUMBER
      Indicates the number filter, which can filter any characters excluding "+-.0123456789".

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        public CharSequence filter​(CharSequence source,
                           InputFilter.Range sourceRange,
                           CharSequence dest,
                           InputFilter.Range destRange)
        Filters the input text, which can be plain text or RichText. If the source is rich text, the text itself will change. In other cases, the text will not change. Depending on the derived class of InputFilter, determine whether to pass null to dest and destRange. For example, pass null if the derived class is CharInputFilter or UpperCaseFilter. For LengthFilter, do not pass null to dest and destRange, because these two parameters restrict the source text together with sourceRange.
        Specified by:
        filter in class InputFilter
        Parameters:
        source - Indicates that source strings to be filtered.
        sourceRange - Indicates the filtering range of the source text. Only text in this range is filtered.
        dest - Indicates the destination text.
        destRange - Indicates the filtering range of the destination text.
        Returns:
        Returns text after filtering; returns null if the input source text is null or the specified Range is invalid.
